meanings.sent1: The exportability of the product made it easy to sell overseas.
meanings.sent2: The company's success in international markets was due to the high exportability of their goods.
meanings.sent3: The exportability of the bananas led to a hilarious mix-up at the port.
meanings.sent4: Her creativity had an exportability that transcended borders and cultures.
meanings.sent5: The exportability of the software was so seamless that users worldwide embraced it.

meanings.definition: The quality of being suitable for export.
meanings.sent1: The exportability of the furniture was evident in its sturdy packaging.
meanings.sent2: The exportability of the fabric made it a popular choice for international designers.
meanings.sent3: The exportability of the fragile vases made the shipping process nerve-wracking.
meanings.sent4: His paintings had an exportability that attracted collectors from around the globe.
meanings.sent5: The exportability of the wine was praised for its consistent quality and taste.

meanings.sent1: The company's growth was directly linked to the exportability of its products.
meanings.sent2: The exportability of the technology allowed for expansion into new markets.
meanings.sent3: The exportability of the fresh produce made it a valuable commodity for trade.
meanings.sent4: Her determination had an exportability that inspired others to reach for their goals.
meanings.sent5: The exportability of the idea sparked interest from investors looking to fund its development.
